title: NORTON.SYSTEMWORKS.2008.PREMIER.EDITION-EDGEISO

        RELEASE NAME ..... Norton SystemWorks 2008 Premier Edition
        SUPPLIER ......... Team EDGE
        CRACKER .......... Team EDGE
        PROTECTION ....... Some very xtream shit for sure :-)
        RELEASE DATE ..... 19/08/2008
        SIZE ............. 2 CDs
        URL .............. http://www.symantec.com/norton/systemworks-premier



  PRODUCT DESCRIPTION

                     Norton SystemWorks 2008 Premier Edition

   Norton SystemWorks Premier Edition defends your computer against spyware
   and viruses, diagnoses and fixes hard drive problems, optimizes computer
   performance, and protect your valuable files.

   Defend against spyware and viruses, enhance your computer's performance,
   and protect your valuable files with the powerful solutions in Norton
   SystemWorks Premier Edition.

What ever you think about Norton they still have some good stuff 
Enjoy

   Norton SystemWorks includes Symantec's award-winning Norton AntiVirus
   software to automatically block spyware, viruses, and other harmful
   programs before they can penetrate your system.

   Norton AntiVirus scans and cleans email and instant messaging attachments
   and Internet downloads. Automatic updates keep your PC protected against
   newly discovered threats throughout your service subscription.

   "Set-and-forget" functionality delivers optimum protection right out of
   the box, and Norton AntiVirus works quietly in the background, so you
   can continue using your computer without disruption.

   The powerful Norton SystemWorks suite also keeps your computer healthy
   and running at peak performance. It diagnoses and fixes hard drive
   errors, and removes unwanted Internet clutter such as cookies and web
   files.

   One-Button Checkup makes sure your PC is clean, repaired, and running at
   top speed with the click of a button. And to improve your computer
   experience, System Optimizer allows you to adjust Windows settings
   from a single screen.

   With digital photographs, tax records, and important documents stored on
   your hard drive, it's essential to back up your data regularly.

   The included Norton Save & Restore software safeguards your computer and
   valuable data with automatic backup and recovery. If disaster strikes,
   you can quickly restore from system failures or recover lost or damaged
   files.

   System Requirements:

     Windows XP SP2 Home / Professional
     400MHz processor or higher
     512MB RAM
     750MB free hard disk space
     Windows Vista Home Starter / Home Premium / Business / Ultimate

  CD1: Norton SystemWorks 2008 Premier
  CD2: Norton Recovery Disc (bootable disc)



  INSTALLATION INSTRUCTIONS

    1. Unrar, Burn or mount with Daemon Tools.

    2. DISCONNECT FROM THE INTERNET! THIS IS IMPORTANT!

    3. Run the installer, and run the keygen located in the EDGE dir.

    4. Select your product then generate and copy the Product Key from
       the keygen to the Norton Setup then press the I Agree button..

    5. Complete installation and finally you will get to the activation,
       it's important that you are NOT connected to the Internet!
       Press the Next button.

    6. A message box will come up telling you that you need Internet
       connectivity to continue, just press the OK Button, and then press
       the Next Button two times until Internet Explorer opens and tells
       you "Internet Explorer cannot display the webpage"

    7. Now copy the entire long URL from Internet Explorer into the keygen
       in the Request URL field, select how many years you would like to
       activate for and press the bottom most generate button.

    8. Wait a few secs, magic is happening, then you will again be told
       that you need Internet connectivity to create your Norton Account,
       just press the Skip button.

    9. Make a big smile as you see your subscription status :)

   10. Enjoy a fully unlocked copy, and naturally DO NOT register this
       software with Symantec, you can now reconnect to the Internet.



       Schmoko, Schmaka, Schmoko! There is too much flerp going around!
